repo/dellfirmware/enabled.description: The Dell Firmware repository boolean. This is dynamically determined by hardware platform.

repo/dellcommunity/url.description: URL for the Dell Community repository

repo/dellomsa/specific/url.description: URL for the Dell OMSA hardware specific repository

repo/elff/enabled.description: Boolean flag for the ELFF repository

repo/dellfirmware/url.description: URL for the Dell Firmware repository

repo/vmware/enabled.description: The VMware repository boolean. This is dynamically determined by hardware platform.

repo/dellomsa/indep/url.description: URL for the Dell OMSA hardware independent repository

repo/vmware/url.description: The URL for the VMWare Tools yum repository

repo/dellomsa/enabled.description: Boolean for the Dell OMSA repositories. This is dynamically determined by hardware platform.

repo/vmware/release.description: Used in determining the VMware repo URL

repo/dellcommunity/enabled.description: The Dell Community repository boolean. This is dynamically determined by hardware platform.

repo/epel/enabled.description: Boolean flag for the EPEL repository

long_description:
= DESCRIPTION:

Manages Yum Repository files in /etc/yum.repos.d on CentOS / RHEL 5.x

= REQUIREMENTS:

This cookbook requires RHEL or CentOS 5.x.  It has not been tested on
other platforms.  It probably will not work with RHEL 4 or CentOS 4,
especially if you have not taken the steps to install yum on that
platform.

The yumrepo::dell recipe requires Dell manufactured hardware.  This
recipe should automatically disable itself by default if non-Dell
hardware is detected by Ohai

The yumrepo::vmware-tools recipe requires a VMWare Virtual Machine.
This recipe should automatically disable itslef by default if
non-VMWare hardware is detected by Ohai.

Recipes tested with Ohai >= 0.5.6

= USAGE:

* yumrepo::default 

  - Provides RPM keys and repo file for
    Fedora EPEL (Extra Packages for Enterprise Linux)

* yumrepo::elff

  - Provides RPM keys and repo file for
    ELFF (Enterprise Linux Fast Forward)

* yumrepo::dell

  - Provides repo files for the following Dell repositories.
    - hardware / Open Manage Server Administrator
    - community / formerly the software repository
    - firmware / Convenient but unsupported by Dell

description: Recipes install and configure several popular RHEL and CentOS 5.x repositories
name: yumrepo
